A) Transparency enables citizens to be better involved in the decision-making process and to ensure greater legitimacy, efficiency and responsibility for the administration towards the citizen in a democratic system. Transparency contributes to the strengthening of the principles of democracy and respect for fundamental rights enshrined in article 6 of the EU-Treaty and in the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union.

B) Publication of information on organizations carrying out eligible activities.

C) Within the framework of the European Transparency Initiative, EU- Member States are obliged to provide information on organizations the eligible activities of payments under the EU- common agricultural policy in the EU- transparency database.

D) The European Commission has set up its own website http://ec.europa.eu/agriculture/funding/index_de.htm, which contains links to the websites of each EU- Member State.

E) With the publication of information on organizations carrying out eligible activities, the European Union pursues the objective of making the public more transparent about how payments in the agricultural sector are used.

F) During the reform of the CAP, the original provisions (Regulation (EG) No 1290/2005 in conjunction with of the implementing Regulation (EG) No 259/2008) on the publication of organizations carrying out eligible activities have been amended by agricultural payments. The existing legal bases for publication are laid down in regulation (EU) no 1306/2013, art. 111-art. 114 and in the implementing Regulation (EU) no 908/2014, art. 57 – art. 62.

G) Accordingly, from 2015 onwards, natural persons must also be published through organizations which carry out eligible activities. To be published are: name, municipality and postal code, amount of payments from the EGFL, amount of payments from the ELER including the national shares, and description of the supported measures, indicating the respective EU- fund.

H) EU- contributions to public consultation of the European Parliament are actions which in turn require a public registration in the EU- transparency database (EU- register).

I) In the national accounts, our organisation contributes in turn to the general- public consultation, which is registered in the transparency database of all organizations, depending on our business accounting.
